title: Here's a reading list of 20 influential articles on neural language text generation up to 2020
**"Sequence to Sequence Learning with Neural Networks"** - Ilya Sutskever, Oriol Vinyals, Quoc V
Introduced the sequence-to-sequence (Seq2Seq) model, foundational for many text generation tasks
**"Neural Machine Translation by Jointly Learning to Align and Translate"** - Dzmitry Bahdanau, Kyunghyun Cho, Yoshua Bengio
Introduced the attention mechanism, which significantly improved Seq2Seq models

author.literal: **"A Neural Conversational Model"** - Oriol Vinyals, Quoc V. Le

title: One of the early works on using neural networks for conversational agents

author.literal: **"Pointer Networks"** - Oriol Vinyals, Meire Fortunato, Navdeep Jaitly

title: Introduced pointer networks, useful for tasks requiring the generation of sequences with elements from the input
**"Teaching Machines to Read and Comprehend"** - Karl Moritz Hermann, et al
Focused on machine reading comprehension, a key aspect of generating coherent and contextually relevant text
**"Sequence Level Training with Recurrent Neural Networks"** - Marc'Aurelio Ranzato, et al
Proposed sequence-level training methods to improve text generation quality
**"A Hierarchical Neural Autoencoder for Paragraphs and Documents"**
note: Jiwei Li, Minh-Thang Luong, Dan Jurafsky (2015

title: Introduced hierarchical models for generating longer texts like paragraphs and documents
**"Generating Sentences from a Continuous Space"**
Explored variational autoencoders (VAEs) for text generation
**"Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dialogue Generation"** - Jiwei Li, et al
Applied reinforcement learning to improve dialogue generation
**"A Diversity-Promoting Objective Function for Neural Conversation Models"** - Jiwei Li, et al
Addressed the issue of generating diverse responses in conversational models
**"Attention Is All You Need"** - Ashish Vaswani, et al
Introduced the Transformer model, which has become the backbone of many state-of-the-art text generation systems
**"Get To The Point: Summarization with Pointer-Generator Networks"**
Proposed a model combining pointing and generation for text summarization
**"Learning to Write with Cooperative Discriminators"** - Yizhe Zhang, et al
Introduced adversarial training methods for text generation
**"Language Modeling with Gated Convolutional Networks"** - Yoon Kim, et al
Explored convolutional networks for language modeling
**"Hierarchical Attention Networks for Document Classification"** - Zichao Yang, et al
Introduced hierarchical attention mechanisms, useful for understanding and generating long texts
**"Improving Neural Language Models with a Continuous Cache"** - Ben Krause, et al
Proposed a continuous cache mechanism to improve language models
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Jacob Devlin, et al
Introduced BERT, a model that has significantly influenced text generation and understanding
**"GPT-2: Better Language Models and Their Implications"** - Alec Radford, et al
Introduced GPT-2, a powerful generative model for text
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** - Zhilin Yang, et al
Proposed XLNet, which combines autoregressive and autoencoding approaches for better text generation
**"CTRL: A Conditional Transformer Language Model for Controllable Generation"** - Nitish Shirish Keskar, et al
Introduced a model for controllable text generation, allowing for more directed and relevant outputs
These articles cover a range of foundational techniques and advancements in neural language text generation, from early Seq2Seq models to the latest Transformer-based architectures
